New Records: Tyrese Maxey made at least three shots from beyond the arc in 10 straight games, a franchise record.
Key Match Events: The Sacramento Kings closed with a 15-0 run to rally past the Philadelphia 76ers.
Paul George had 30 points, eight rebounds, and five assists for the 76ers.
Tyrese Maxey added 27 points, six assists, and four steals.
Domantas Sabonis had 17 points, 21 rebounds, and seven assists.
Malik Monk added 20 points and six assists.
A goaltending call against the 76ers on Monk's driving layup gave the Kings the lead with 33.1 seconds to play.
George lost the ball and fouled Monk, who hit two free throws to make it 111-107 with 7.1 seconds left.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Joel Embiid (sprained left foot) and Kelly Oubre Jr. (sprained left hand) did not play for the Sixers.
Keegan Murray was sidelined for the Kings with left ankle soreness.
Sacramento trailed by 14 in the first half but tied it 57-all at halftime.
Philadelphia led 107-98 with 3:15 remaining before the Kings took over.
Sacramento held the 76ers scoreless for the final 3:30 and improved to 8-12 at home.
Sabonis pulled down nine of Sacramento's 14 offensive rebounds.
